An **orcish scimitar** is a type of one-handed [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), and is an [orcish](/wiki/Orcish "Orcish") variant of the standard [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"). It has a base [object material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(EvilHack\) "Object materials (EvilHack)") of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **crude curved sword** when unidentified.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Many [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") are naturally generated with orcish scimitars. [Hobgoblins](/wiki/Hobgoblin "Hobgoblin"), [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster\) "Orc (monster)") and [hill orcs](/wiki/Hill_orc "Hill orc") have a 1⁄4 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an orcish scimitar. [Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") and [goblin-captains](/wiki/Goblin-captain "Goblin-captain") have a 1⁄3 chance of being generated with an orcish scimitar; [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Mordor orc weapons, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with orcish scimitars. [Orcish](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") [soldiers](/wiki/Soldiers "Soldiers"), [watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and lieutenants may also generate with orcish scimitars.

An orcish scimitar can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining an [orcish short sword](/wiki/Orcish_short_sword "Orcish short sword") and a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife").

## Strategy

Orcish scimitars are generally weaker than regular scimitars: they deal less damage versus small monsters, and their [object material](/wiki/Object_material "Object material") restrictions make it impossible to forge non-iron ones. One advantage they have is that they are more likely to be made of [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone") than standard scimitars, and orcs in general are a somewhat reliable source of bone weapons that can be used to hit [ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") and other incorporeal monsters.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Scimitar](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scimitar "wikipedia:Scimitar")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Orc](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orc "wikipedia:Orc")***

A scimitar (/ˈsɪmɪtər/ or /ˈsɪmɪtɑːr/) is a type of single-edged sword with a convex curved blade that is often used for mounted combat. The term is European in origin, and covers an assortment of different "Eastern" curved swords. Though commonly associated with West Asian, South Asian, and North African cultures, various types of curved [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") are used in various other cultures, including several "Western" ones. The scimitar also commonly serves as a symbol of the "East" and the Islamic world, and said association also overlaps with the portrayal of orcs in various forms of literature as a form of barbaric horde from faraway lands (hence their tendency to appear with scimitars).
